value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JlUfz18cx_w" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TEIdI5bFCSU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1bp_e-ik7aA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Slicers vs. Slicer Pane vs. Filter Pane! Which is faster?
value.excerpt: You have different options in Power BI when it comes to slicers and filters. Just put the slicer on the report, use a slicer panel or have them in the filter pane. But which one is faster??? Patrick explores a few scenarios to think about!  Should you hide the filter pane in Power BI? https://greyskullanalytics.com/should-you-hide-the-filter-pane-in-power-bi/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TfXhQG61sPw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Storytelling with Power BI and PowerPoint
value.excerpt: Give up those static images of your reports in PowerPoint! Learn how to integrate your Power BI report to help tell your story directly within PowerPoint!  Tell a story with your data. Announcing the all-new Power BI integration for PowerPoint https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/tell-a-story-with-your-data-announcing-the-all-new-power-bi-integration-for-powerpoint/

value.title: Time to look at the new INDEX function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: The latest DAX functions in Power BI can be very "power"ful! Patrick starts by looking at the INDEX function to solve a customer problem!  Blog announcement: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/power-bi-december-2022-feature-summary/#post-21693-_Toc121395731  INDEX function (DAX) https://learn.microsoft.com/dax/index-function-dax

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html

value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
value.excerpt: You need a connector to work with data in Power Query for Power BI or Excel. But what is a connector? Adam explains what these are and how to find out what's available.  Power Query Connectors: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/connectors/  Power BI data sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources

value.title: Why is Power BI SLOW
value.excerpt: We've seen people comment that Power BI is SLOW. But, what they really mean is your report is slow. Patrick breaks things down to get you pointed in the right direction. value.title: Working with Slowly Changing Dimensions in Power BI

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Is Power BI Certification Worth It? 💲💲💲 (Exam DA-100 / Exam 70-778 / Certified Data Analyst…)
value.excerpt: You may be considering taking the Microsoft Power BI Certification Exams…but should you? But before you put in the time, effort and money $$$...shouldn't you ask yourself "Is Power BI Certification Even Worth It?"  I am going to tell you 3 reasons you should and 3 reasons you shouldn't take these exams.

There are two types of combining queries; Merge, and Append. Database developers easily understand the difference, but the majority of
